Detailed Description

Represents a sorted list of key/value pairs in memory.

All updates get written to the CellCache and later get "compacted" into a CellStore on disk.

Member Function Documentation

int CellCache::add ( const ByteString  key,
const ByteString  value,
uint64_t  real_timestamp 
) [virtual]

Adds a key/value pair to the CellCache.

This method assumes that the CellCache has been locked by a call to lock. Copies of the key and value are created and inserted into the underlying cell map

Parameters:
key key to be inserted
value value to inserted
real_timestamp real commit log timestamp
Returns:
zero

Implements Hypertable::CellList.

const char * CellCache::get_split_row (  )  [virtual]

Returns a split row for this cell list.

This should be an approximation of the middle row key in the list.

Returns:
the split row key

Definition at line 72 of file CellCache.h.

CellCache * CellCache::slice_copy ( uint64_t  timestamp  ) 

Makes a copy of this CellCache, but only includes the key/value pairs that have a timestamp greater than the timestamp argument.

This must be called with the cell cache locked.

This method is called after a compaction to drop the key/value pairs that were compacted to disk.

Parameters:
timestamp cutoff timestamp
Returns:
The new "sliced" copy of the cell cache

Definition at line 162 of file CellCache.cc.

CellCache * CellCache::purge_deletes (  ) 

Purges all deleted pairs along with the corresponding delete entries.

Returns:
The new "purged" copy of the cell cache

Definition at line 203 of file CellCache.cc.

uint64_t Hypertable::CellCache::memory_used (  )  [inline]

Returns the amount of memory used by the CellCache.

This is the summation of the lengths of all the keys and values in the map.
